p: The investigated Mentha species also revealed some activity to inhibit the enzyme tyrosinase. Among thirteen species, the methanolic extracts of M. pulegium (123.89 ± 5.64 μg KAE/g) and M. x piperita (102.82 ± 15.16 μg KAE/g) showed the highest activities ( Table 2). Though it has been suggested that the activity of the plant extracts against tyrosinase could be attributed to the presence of hydroxycinnamic acids and flavonoids [ 55], there was no positive correlation between the activity of the extracts and phenolic and flavonoid contents in the present study. However, other authors have observed no tyrosinase inhibition or very weak inhibition in mint extracts [ 50, 68].
